attributes.additional_details:
Without prominent clarification, retractions often go unnoticed by all but those who make & follow complaints, leaving many still believing flawed articles to be true. 
Front page/Headline/Lead broadcast news story; However the original piece was presented, the retraction should be presented similarly.
If the misleading item is a single sentence within a leading article, the retraction should be made with a similar sized headline, on the same page (or similar position in tv/radio news program).
attributes.background:
Misleading articles are often brandished across all media platforms. When complaints are made & upheld, retractions are always short, almost hidden from view in print, and only briefly noted on other media.
Retractions should be made with the same prominence as the original, incorrect, story.
